marquees.title: This is a MarqueeText a React Component written in TypeScript.
Let's bring it back to the internet days of yore.
Created by Stephen Scaff for your text moving pleasure.
Snag it on NPM and get that text moving.

intro.lead: MarqueeText is a React component that takes it back to the internet of days gone by. Paying homage to the vintage (and beloved) Marquee element, MarqueeText inserts areas of continuous scrolling text, empowering your retro or brutalist-inspried designs.MarqueeText is a React component that takes it back to the internet of days gone by. features.title: üìå Features
items: Creates continuous scrolling animations of text.
Creates continuous loop effect by cloning text to ensure it fills container.
Scrolling animation starts / stops when text is in viewport (by default), via Intersection Observer
Options to control scrolling direction and duration.

quickStart.title: üéØ Quick Start
quickStart.install: Simply install the package from npm
quickStart.use: Now import MarqueeText, provide some text and pass in any desired options.

optionsTable.description: React children for providing text as string
Defines a parent class name for BEM-like naming
Amount of time it takes for original text to complete animation
Only run play animation when component is visible in viewport
Intersection Observer value between 0 and 1 representing the percentage component must be visible before stagger animation starts.
Adds will-change to animation to potentially enhance animation performance

items.title: CSS Import
items.content: The package largely uses inlined CSS. Currently, the `@keyframes` animation is the only declaration housed in an external CSS file. `styles.css` is imported into the `tsx` file, but given your bundle setup, you may, or may not, have to handle that import. If the animation doesn't run immediately, try importing `react-marquee-text/styles.css` directly in your project.
